Class MazeSolver

java.lang.Object
MazeSolver
public class MazeSolver
extends java.lang.Object
Solves a 2D maze given an array of positions of the map.
Author:
Wil Simpson

  • Field Summary

    Fields 
    Modifier and Type Field Description
    private char deadEndChar
    Char to mark path leads to a deadend
    boolean isStartOfMaze
    Whether the current mazeTraversal is at the starting point

    Char that can be traversed
    private char mazeWall
    Char that cannot be traversed
    private char movedChar
    Char to mark that as a correct maze path
    private long sleepTime
    Time to sleep between maze traversals
    boolean solved
    Whether the current mazeTraversal has been solved
    private int startingCol
    Starting col position, starting index at 0
    private int startingRow
    Starting row position, starting index at 0

  • Constructor Details

    • MazeSolver

      public MazeSolver​(char mazeWall, char mazePath, char movedChar, char deadEndChar, int startingRow, int startingCol, long sleepTime)
      Initiailize a MazeSolver with the given parameters
      Parameters:
      mazeWall - non-traversable position
      mazePath - traversable position
      movedChar - marker to show that moved to
      deadEndChar - marker to show a deadend has been reached on that path
      startingRow - starting row in maze
      startingCol - starting col in maze
      sleepTime - sleep time between maze traversals

  • Method Details

    • mazeTraversal

      public boolean mazeTraversal​(char[][] maze, int row, int col) throws java.lang.InterruptedException
      A maze consists of a 2D char array. Increasing or decreasing the row traverses the maze down or up respectively. Increase or decreasing the col traverses the maze to the right or left respectively.
      Parameters:
      maze - 2D maze to traverse
      row - current row position
      col - current col position
      Returns:
      whether the maze was solved or not
      Throws:
      java.lang.InterruptedException - thrown if thread is interrupted during sleep

    • tryMoveTo

      private void tryMoveTo​(char[][] maze, int row, int col, char movedChar, char charType) throws java.lang.InterruptedException
      Moves to the position if possible and marks it with the given charType
      Parameters:
      maze - 2D maze to traverse
      row - current row to move from
      col - current col to move from
      movedChar - traversable char
      charType - char to use as mark
      Throws:
      java.lang.InterruptedException - thrown if thread is interrupted during sleep

    • canMoveTo

      public boolean canMoveTo​(char[][] maze, int row, int col, char moveableChar)
      Checks if the given char is traversable
      Parameters:
      maze - 2D maze to check against
      row - row to check
      col - col to check
      moveableChar - acceptable char to move to
      Returns:
      true if it can move to

    • printMaze

      public static void printMaze​(char[][] maze)
      Prints a given maze
      Parameters:
      maze - maze to print

    • printMaze

      public static void printMaze​(char[][] maze, char deadEndChar, char mazePath)
      Prints a given maze and replaces instances of the deadEndChar with the mazePath char
      Parameters:
      maze - maze to print
      deadEndChar - char that will be replaced
      mazePath - char that will replace
